meanings.definition: A temporary suspension of an activity or law
meanings.sent1: The government announced a moratoriums on fishing in the river to protect endangered species.
meanings.sent2: The moratoriums on construction projects due to the storm will be lifted next week.
meanings.sent3: During the moratoriums on dessert consumption, everyone's sweet tooth felt neglected.
meanings.sent4: The moratoriums on social gatherings cast a quiet stillness over the town.
meanings.sent5: The moratoriums on noise pollution made the neighborhood unusually peaceful.

meanings.definition: A delay or postponement of a certain action or decision
meanings.sent1: The moratoriums on the new policy implementation caused confusion among the employees.
meanings.sent2: The moratoriums on the court case were frustrating for both parties involved.
meanings.sent3: The moratoriums on bedtime were met with cheers from the children.
meanings.sent4: The moratoriums on the project deadline loomed like a dark cloud over the team.
meanings.sent5: The moratoriums on the flight departure left passengers stranded at the airport.
